text: Tredegar is a town and community in Blaenau Gwent, Wales. As of 2011, the town had a population of 15,103. Tredegar used to part of Monmouthshire. Tredegar is the birthplace of politicians Aneurin Bevan and Neil Kinnock, and also snooker player Ray Reardon. ==References== Category:Towns in Wales
title: Tredegar
